intro: Hoyopsis, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Hoyopsis species are adapted to arid environments and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. They are sometimes used in traditional medicine and for their ornamental value.
